explainability.findings: Technical papers reference the use of explainable AI to provide rationales for decisions.
explainability.path_to_improvement: Publish user-facing explanation interfaces or documented appeal workflows.

relevant_sources.summary: This technical paper on AI in Revenue Cycle Management provides evidence for several responsible AI pillars. It supports **governance** and **oversight** by detailing the establishment of governance councils, oversight committees, and regular audits for AI tools. The paper also offers evidence for **fairness** and **explainability** through mentions of bias monitoring, fairness audits, and the use of explainable AI to provide rationales for decisions. Furthermore, it touches upon **transparency** by describing specific AI applications and their quantifiable outcomes, and **external accountability** through discussions of algorithmic accountability and legal responsibility for automated errors. Finally, the paper acknowledges **privacy** concerns related to AI systems.
relevant_sources.title: AI in Revenue Cycle Management (RCM) and Medical Claims Processing

external_accountability.findings: Technical papers discuss algorithmic accountability. They also discuss legal responsibility for automated errors.
external_accountability.path_to_improvement: Publish third-party audit results, certifications, or regulatory compliance documentation.

governance.findings: Documentation implies governance through mentions of integration with clinical documentation requirements and AI-driven workflows for revenue optimization. It also references AI applications and specialist certificates, indicating governance over AI use through training and a clear understanding of AI specialists. Technical papers further detail the establishment of governance councils, oversight committees, and regular audits for AI tools.
governance.path_to_improvement: Name an AI governance body with defined mandate covering all AI use.

relevant_sources.summary: This press release provides evidence for the **governance, privacy, and transparency** pillars of responsible AI. It supports transparency by explicitly mentioning the "Commure Ambient AI" platform and detailing its capabilities and scope across the patient journey and clinician workflow. The press release also implies governance through mentions of integration with clinical documentation requirements and AI-driven workflows for revenue optimization, and suggests privacy considerations through the mention of "data security and compliance."
relevant_sources.title: Commure to Deploy Ambient AI Platform to Tenet Physician Network

relevant_sources.summary: This third-party source provides evidence for the **governance** and **transparency** pillars of responsible AI. summary.overall_findings: Tenet Healthcare's disclosures explicitly mention the "Commure Ambient AI" platform, detailing its capabilities and scope across the patient journey and clinician workflow. This evidence contributes to documented public evidence for all 7 evaluated responsible AI pillars. Published materials also reference bias monitoring and fairness audits for AI tools, alongside the establishment of governance councils and oversight committees. Further, technical papers discuss algorithmic accountability and legal responsibility for automated errors, drawing from 6 publicly available sources.
